column4: i can't read out my dvd :( it says error while reading from file: input/output error  :(
if it's a movie, you might want to check out libdvdcss
installed libdvdcss allready
is there anything more to the error?
its an input/output error
is that all you get?
maybe because of a hard copy protection
yes
do most other dvds work?
depending on dvd
maybe you don't have your dvd region set?  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats/PlayingDVDs
how to set this?
follow link in previous post
copying with sudo mc (midnight commander) showed "Input/output error (5)" too well lets check your page
i didnt install libdvdread3 so far :-) maybe thats it?
that would do it
do i have to reboot after regionset ?
i don't believe so
nice i've set the region settings now and i can play it :D
enjoy
my region setting was at "RPC Phase: II   type: NONE     Vendor resets available: 4  user controlled changes resets available: 5  drive plays discs from region(s):, mask=0xFF
what is mask=0xFF for a region? my region 2 is mask=0xFFFFFFFD
and my last question is. is this region setting now saved inside my disc drive or where is it stored? and is it stored forever?
are you still there?
